We are aware of the state’s guidance released today to allow spectators at our athletic events. Please be aware that these headlines are misleading. A strict capacity limit of no more than 250 persons remains in place on outdoor gatherings (games). The capacity limit includes both teams, coaches, referees and any essential operating personnel. The capacity limit now has the ability to allow spectators if the amount falls within the limit.

MASD will be working on a system to potentially allow a very limited amount of spectators to be able to attend outdoor athletic events at home.

Further details will be provided in the near future.

Go Tigers!

As our nation is combating all of the effects of COVID-19, we cannot forget the impact that this is having on all of our students, especially our senior class of 2020.

In an effort to brighten up their moods and show support for them and their families, we would like all Tigers to “Light the Night.”

On May 8, our senior class would have been completing their senior project presentations. It is a special day for not only the students, but the staff and retirees who participate, as well. To commemorate this day and lift up our senior class, we invite you to light up the front of your homes and porches on May 8, from 9-10 p.m. to show your support of our seniors. Make sure you snap a picture and send it to us in a message!

We want all students to know that we are thinking of them and are here for them during this time!
